intro: Uvariastrum pynaertii, commonly known as the African starfruit vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, round fruits that resemble starfruit in appearance. Uvariastrum pynaertii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
